alert.note: Alert for Concho; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 3:07PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Tom Green and Concho Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 306 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms across southern Tom Green and Concho counties, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Christoval, Eden, Knickerbocker, Vancourt, Millersview, Live Oak, The Intersection Of Us- 87 And Ranch Road 2134, Vick, The Intersection Of Us- 83 And Ranch Road 765 and Us-83 Near The Menard-Concho County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
